@graph.headline: The Real Technical Split: Pre- vs. Post-Purchase Upsells
@graph.description: A comprehensive technical analysis of pre-purchase versus post-purchase upsells, covering implementation differences, risk profiles, and strategic considerations for e-commerce optimization.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Pre-Purchase Upsell
hasDefinedTerm.description: An offer shown before a customer pays, modifying the current shopping cart by adding or upgrading items before the transaction is completed.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Post-Purchase Upsell
hasDefinedTerm.description: An offer shown after a customer completes payment, creating a new, separate transaction using tokenized payment information for one-click acceptance.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Average Order Value (AOV)
hasDefinedTerm.description: The average dollar amount spent each time a customer places an order, calculated by dividing total revenue by number of orders.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Payment Tokenization
hasDefinedTerm.description: A security process where sensitive payment data is replaced with a unique identifier (token) that can be used for subsequent transactions without exposing card details.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)
hasDefinedTerm.description: The total revenue a business can expect from a single customer account throughout their relationship with the company.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Conversion Rate
hasDefinedTerm.description: The percentage of visitors who complete a desired action, such as making a purchase, out of the total number of visitors.

hasDefinedTerm.name: AJAX
hasDefinedTerm.description: Asynchronous JavaScript and XML - a web development technique for creating interactive web applications by exchanging data with a server behind the scenes.

@graph.name: Setting Up Post-Purchase Upsells on Shopify
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide for implementing post-purchase upsell funnels on Shopify using third-party applications.

supply.name: Upsell App (Rebuy, AfterSell, or Zipify OCU)

step.name: Install & Connect
step.text: Install the app and grant it permissions to talk to your payment gateway.

step.name: Create a Funnel
step.text: Give it a descriptive name, like 'Camera Body -> Lens Upsell'.

step.name: Set the Trigger
step.text: Tell the app to fire this funnel only when a specific product is in the completed order.

step.name: Build the Upsell Offer
step.text: Design the offer page, select the upsell product, write compelling copy, and add a discount if appropriate.

step.name: Build the Downsell
step.text: Configure the funnel to offer a cheaper alternative if they decline the main upsell.

step.name: Activate & Monitor
step.text: Turn on the funnel and monitor the analytics dashboard, making data-driven optimizations.

mainEntity.name: How much does a pre-purchase offer really hurt the user experience?

acceptedAnswer.text: It can be brutal. A badly timed, irrelevant pre-purchase pop-up feels like a pushy salesperson blocking the aisle. A post-purchase offer is more like the cashier helpfully asking if you need batteries for the thing you just bought. The psychological state of the customer is completely different.

mainEntity.name: If I'm paranoid about my conversion rate, which one do I use?

acceptedAnswer.text: Post-purchase. It's not even a debate. Since the original order is 100% complete before the offer is ever shown, there is literally zero risk to your core conversion rate.
